title: 香港時間6點正 將#FreedomHKG洗上Twitter熱門

replies.msg:
相信好多人都唔識玩Twitter。

Twitter有樣最重要嘅功能，係可以實時睇到該地區同世界有幾多條Tweet係用左個Hashtag。
佢係分worldwide同by country但唔係最重要。

要將hashtag發揮到最大作用，除咗一直出帖，最重要係一段短時間一齊出帖。

我希望發動今日G20正中間香港夜晚6點正，將#AntiELAB #FreedomHK #FreedomHKG 洗上熱門！
可參考 https://trends24.in/

大前題係twitter 申請API
Python Code( For retweet)
pip install tweepy

import tweepy
CONSUMER_KEY=' '
CONSUMER_SECRET=' '
ACCESS_KEY=' '
ACCESS_SECRET=' '

auth = tweepy.OAuthHandler(CONSUMER_KEY, CONSUMER_SECRET)
auth.set_access_token(ACCESS_KEY, ACCESS_SECRET)
api = tweepy.API(auth)


def main():
search=("#FreedomHK","AntiELAB")
numberofTweets=100
for tweet in tweepy.Cursor(api.search,search).items(numberofTweets):
try:
tweet.retweet()
print("Tweet Retweeted")
except tweepy.TweepError as e:
print(e.reason)
except StopIteration:
break
main()

Hi there,

If you want to know more about the political turmoil in HK right now, scroll down for info.

Further reading:

1.Local backlash

This website sums up the reasons why Hongkongers found the extradition bill revolting.
https://beta.hackfoldr.org/extradition/https%253A%252F%252Fextradition.g0vhk.io%252F

Hong Kong Bar Association has also voiced out against this piece of legislation
Brief guide
https://bit.ly/2Ip6QLD

Observations
https://bit.ly/2IFOPdU
https://bit.ly/2WD2gU7

2.International criticisms
Numerous legal associations have jointly issued an opinion piece, criticising the extradition bill as ”ill-conceived proposals” that “fundamentally imperil the operation of the rule of law in
Hong Kong.”
https://www.fairtrials.org/sites/default/files/publication_pdf/Joint-observations-human-rights-implications-Hong-Kong-Fugitive-Offenders-Mutual-Legal-Assistance-Criminal-Matters-Legislation.pdf

3.Police brutality

Amnesty International recently published a report, stating that during the protest on June 12th, “the use of force by police in the largely peaceful protest was unnecessary and excessive. The use of force during the protest violated international human rights law and standards.”
https://www.amnesty.org/en/documents/asa17/0576/2019/en/

Verified footages corresponding to their locations available in this interactive map
https://story.mapme.com/5f0f348c-8af8-44e5-bfa6-4c55de1bbec0

More footages:
https://elab.hker.tech/1TKFgCjzW5XTcIIRcu1gg_WK4BsQADHOz5lJHPXGsPc4/https%253A%252F%252Fethercalc.org%252Felabpolice


We Hongkongers will not yield until the regime satisfies our 5 demands:
— Fully withdraw (instead of “postponement”) the extradition bill
— Retract the official characterisation of the protest as “riot”
— Release all arrested protesters and promise that they won’t be prosecuted in the future
— Make police liable for their brutality
— HK chief executive, Carrie Lam, resigns

Thank you for your attention

Best wishes,
A HongKonger

食住報紙既勢！
你估trending咁易上
洗 佢 老 味 版 ！

大家如果驚無嘢寫
可以試下將下面嘅文件逐少逐少copy上去

1.Local backlash

This website sums up the reasons why Hongkongers found the extradition bill revolting.
https://beta.hackfoldr.org/extradition/https%253A%252F%252Fextradition.g0vhk.io%252F

Hong Kong Bar Association has also voiced out against this piece of legislation
Brief guide
https://bit.ly/2Ip6QLD

Observations
https://bit.ly/2IFOPdU
https://bit.ly/2WD2gU7

2.International criticisms
Numerous legal associations have jointly issued an opinion piece, criticising the extradition bill as ”ill-conceived proposals” that “fundamentally imperil the operation of the rule of law in
Hong Kong.”
https://www.fairtrials.org/sites/default/files/publication_pdf/Joint-observations-human-rights-implications-Hong-Kong-Fugitive-Offenders-Mutual-Legal-Assistance-Criminal-Matters-Legislation.pdf

3.Police brutality

Amnesty International recently published a report, stating that during the protest on June 12th, “the use of force by police in the largely peaceful protest was unnecessary and excessive. The use of force during the protest violated international human rights law and standards.”
https://www.amnesty.org/en/documents/asa17/0576/2019/en/

Verified footages corresponding to their locations available in this interactive map
https://story.mapme.com/5f0f348c-8af8-44e5-bfa6-4c55de1bbec0

More footages:
https://elab.hker.tech/1TKFgCjzW5XTcIIRcu1gg_WK4BsQADHOz5lJHPXGsPc4/https%253A%252F%252Fethercalc.org%252Felabpolice


We Hongkongers will not yield until the regime satisfies our 5 demands:
— Fully withdraw (instead of “postponement”) the extradition bill
— Retract the official characterisation of the protest as “riot”
— Release all arrested protesters and promise that they won’t be prosecuted in the future
— Make police liable for their brutality
— HK chief executive, Carrie Lam, resigns

Thank you for your attention

Best wishes,
A HongKonger
